results.title: Crocodile Dundee: Crocodile Dundee II
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Hoyts, Paramount Pictures and Rimfire Films
results.brief_description: This double set features Australia’s highest grossing comedy film, ‘Crocodile Dundee’, and its significantly less successful sequel. ‘Crocodile Dundee’ (Producer: John Cornell, Director: Peter Faiman) A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. ‘Crocodile Dundee II’ (Producers: John Cornell, Jane Scott, Director: John Cornell) begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend, who he managed to secure in the first film. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them. Cast includes Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon, Mark Blum and David Gulpilil.

results.title: Night on earth
results.brief_description: This film by the talented independent director, Jim Jarmusch, is a collection of five vignettes each taking place in the confines of a taxi ride. Covering one night on earth, the stories occur simultaneously in five different cities and five different time zones: Los Angeles, New York City, Paris, London and Helsinki. Highlights include Roberto Benigni as the Roman taxi driver who recounts his past sexual exploits to a priest who is dying of a heart-attack in the back seat. In the New York scene a novice East German taxi driver (Armin Mueller-Stahl) has trouble with the foot pedals and his passenger ends up driving himself to Brooklyn. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Rosie Perez, Giancarlo Esposito, Winona Ryder, Beatrice Dalle.

results.title: Leo Tolstoy's Anna Karenina
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rose, Bruce Davey and ICON
results.brief_description: This adaptation of the Leo Tolstoy masterpiece, “Anna Karenin”, is noted for its stunning cinematography of the foggy Russian landscape. The screenplay is a faithful but abridged version of the novel set in 1880s Russia. The heroine, Anna (Sophie Marceau), is not happy in her marriage to the staid Karenin (James Fox), despite the joy she finds in their son. When she meets Count Vronsky (Sean Bean) in Moscow, where she goes to sort out the marriage problems of her brother, her life is turned upside-down. Their passionate affair causes her to lose her standing in society, being an unfaithful woman, to lose her son and eventually to lose the happiness she so desperately craved. The story is a tragic reminder of the downfall of a woman who dares to rebel against the rules of society. This affair is paralleled by the romance between Levin (Alfred Molina), the narrator of the story who is said to represent Tolstoy, and the young Kitty (Mia Kirshner), who had been in love with Vronsky until Anna captured his attentions. In English with occasional Russian dialogue subtitled in English.

results.title: Basketball diaries
results.creator_credit: Scott Kalvert, Liz Heller and Island Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘The Basketball Diaries’ is a horrowing growing-up story based on the true-life exploits of poet and musician Jim Carroll. Jim begins as a high-school basketball star at a Catholic high school where he experiments with drugs and is physically abused by his teachers. When his best friend dies of leukemia, Jim’s life suddenly becomes much more than adolescent angst, with him making the dark descent into the hell of heroin addiction and hustling. Jim’s poetry is the only thing he has left when he is found, literally on the street, by a tough ex-junkie, who undertakes his rehabilitation. Cast include: Leonardo Di Caprio, Bruno Kirby, Juliette Lewis and Ernie Hudson.

results.title: Lost honour of Katharina Blum = Die verlorene Ehre der Katharina Blum
results.creator_credit: Margarethe Von Trotta, Volker Schlondorff, Willi Benninger, Bioskop Film, Cinema International Corp, Orion Pictures Corporation, Paramount Pictures and WDR
results.brief_description: Katharina Blum (Angela Winkler) spends the night with Ludwig Goetten (Jurgen Prochnow), a new acquaintance who is, unknown to her, under police surveillance. This one night stand has serious repercussions for Katharina who is brought in for police questioning. Her basic civil rights ignored at every turn, Katharina is relentlessly grilled about her relationship with her one-night stand. As a result she loses her job, her friends, and her standing in the community. Unsatisfied with this, the police go after Katharina’s family. Her story is also exploited by the ‘yellow press’, which hounds her and depicts her as everything from loose woman to communist moll. And so, through the mirror of a manipulative press, Katharina becomes the most hated woman in Germany. The film achieves a compelling portrait of Germany in the mid-seventies (the lead years), during which the fight against the Red Army Faction led a number of State agencies to use any means possible to fight terrorism, while a manipulative right wing press sent an entire country in a frenzy over the breakdown of law and order. This originally made for TV production is adapted from the novel by Heinrich Boll (itself based on actual events). In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Street of shame = Akasen chitai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Janus Films
results.brief_description: The setting is a Tokyo brothel, ironically called Dreamland. The content is the thoughts, disappointments and aspirations of the occupants. This was Mizoguchi’s final film, and one in which he returned to his earlier theme of the exploitation of women throughout the ages. He does so by integrating the stories of five prostitutes which covers the roles of women as daughters, mothers and wives. Many believe that this film was pivotal in the 1957 decision to abolish prostitution in Japan. Cast includes Daisuke Kato, Machiko Kyo and Aiko Mimasu.

results.title: Tokyo story = Tokyo monogatari
results.brief_description: Ozu considered what many regard as his finest film to be about the disintegration of the Japanese family system. Ordinary family events - the visit of parents to see the children and their cool reception - are profoundly moving as Ozu portrays them. ‘Tokyo Story’ is actually a recasting of Leo McCarey’s ‘Make Way For Tomorrow’ which his collaborator, Noda, had seen but Ozu had not. As in most of his later films there is a pervasive nostalgia, a sense of loss. Although a loosely plotted leisurely survey of the extended family structured around journeys, the film is full of conflicts triggered by the grandparents’ visit in which characterisation both enriches and qualifies stark thematic oppositions.

results.title: Simba
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and Group Film Productions
results.brief_description: Allan Howard (Dirk Bogarde) arrives in Kenya to join his brother on the farm; tragedy awaits him when he discovers that his brother has been brutally murdered by the nationalistic Mau Mau tribe. He finds solace, and eventually love with neighbour Mary Crawford (Virginia McKenna). Alan works with the local Police Inspector (Donald Sinden), and together they suspect that the local African doctor, known only as Simba, is the leader behind the Mau Mau terrorist attacks. They must now play a tense waiting game. Based on actual events that occurred to British settlers in Kenya in the 1950s.

results.title: The Parent trap
results.brief_description: A summer camp turns into a life altering adventure when two long lost twin sisters (both played by Hayley Mills), are reunited. Together the newly formed friends devise a fiendish plot to rekindle the romance between their separated parents and live as one happy family. With two minds on the job there’s double the chance of success! Cast includes Maureen O’Hara, Brian Keith, Charlie Ruggles and Una Merkel. Based on the novel ‘Das Doppelte lottchen’ by Erich Kastner.

results.title: Up close & personal (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jon Avnet, David Nicksay, Jordan Kerner and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings, Sally Atwater (Michelle Pfeiffer) is about to hit the big time. Arriving from a trailer park in Nevada, an overeager and overdressed weather girl, she makes a disastrous debut on national television. All is not lost however as her passion for the job captures the eye of the experienced, and handsome newsman, Warren Justice (Robert Redford). With Warren’s help Sally is transformed, Pygmalian style, into a popular and respected journalist. Along the way romance develops, but this is threatened by Sally’s newfound success and they must find a balance between love and their successful careers. Cast includes Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna and Kate Nelligan.
